meanings.definition: The development of a disease or abnormal condition
meanings.sent1: Understanding the pathogenesis of cancer is crucial for effective treatment.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the pathogenesis of various illnesses to improve patient care.
meanings.sent3: The pathogenesis of a cold can sometimes feel like a mysterious puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The pathogenesis of addiction can be compared to a tangled web that is hard to break free from.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing the pathogenesis of a virus can help in creating vaccines.

meanings.definition: The origination and development of a disease
meanings.sent1: Research into the pathogenesis of diabetes has led to better management strategies.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the pathogenesis of a disease can aid in prevention efforts.
meanings.sent3: The pathogenesis of a new outbreak can sometimes surprise even seasoned epidemiologists.
meanings.sent4: The pathogenesis of a rumor spreading is similar to how a virus infects a community.
meanings.sent5: The pathogenesis of a problem often lies in its root causes.
